Getting Started With Android Studio – Part I

Posted on January 17, 2018 by Kartik B. under Android Studio

Android Studio is Google’s officially supported IDE for developing Android apps. Based on IntelliJ IDEA, Android Studio is freely available under Apache License 2.0. In this guide we will be installing Android Studio in windows and setting up our first android project.

 

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

  • Microsoft Windows 7/8/10 (32-bit or 64-bit)
  • 2 GB RAM minimum, 8 GB RAM recommended
  • 2 GB of available disk space minimum, 4 GB Recommended 
  • 1280 x 800 minimum screen resolution
  • JDK 8

 

STEP 1 — DOWNLOADING THE INSTALLER

 

Head over to the https://developer.android.com/studio/index.html and download it from the Download Android Studio button in the page. In my case 3.0.1 is the latest one

 

STEP 2 — THE SETUP

 

Open the .exe file downloaded and you will be presented with the following dialog.

 

 

Click Next

 

 

Select the android virtual devices under the components and click next.

 

 

Select the installation location and click next.

 

 

Click Next.

 

 

It will start installing the components and the android studio itself and it might take a while.

 

 

Once done click finish.

 

 

It will ask you to import settings from any previous version, Since we are installing for the first time, select Do not import settings and click OK.

 

 

It will take you to the welcome wizard. Click next

 

 

Choose the type of installation for the android studio. We will be choosing the standard type here, feel free to customize your own needs.Click Next

 

 

Select the theme of your choice and click next.

 

 

Check the Android Virtual Device (AVD) under components and click next.

 

 

The next window will show you the summary of the components and their sizes that are to be installed . Click finish to proceed.

This completes the installation part of this guide.

 

 

STEP 3 — STARTING A NEW PROJECT

 

 

Click on Start a new Android Studio Project

 

 

Enter the name of the application as you wish and the the company domain name. You should then see C:\Users\<USER>\AndroidStudioProjects\<APPLICATION NAME> as the project location. Click Next.

 

 

Select the minimum version of android you want your app to support for. If you want your app to support other platforms like Android wear or TV, select them too. Click next when you are done.

 

 

As of now select the activity as as Empty Activity and click next.

 

 

Next up, it will start installing the required components. once done, click next.

 

 

Select the C++ standard and click next

 

 

CONCLUSION

 

You’ve successfully installed and configured Android Studio and created a project for your first Android Studio mobile app. Now you’re ready to build your Android application. In next guide we will see the basic components of android studio and work with them.

Congratulations, you have reached to the end of this guide. Hope you had fun installing with us. Subscribe here for more such guides.
